newsitem.title: USA: ARCO Chemical sets $2.6 bln spending plan.
newsitem.headline: ARCO Chemical sets $2.6 bln spending plan.

text.p: ARCO Chemical Co said Tuesday its directors approved a $2.6 billion capital spending program for the years 1997-2001.
In addition, the company said, its capital spending program for 1996 was increased to reflect the recent acquisition of Olin Corp's isocyanates business.
For 1996, ARCO Chemical's capital spending program is set at $750 million, including amounts allocated for the purchase of Olin's isocyanates business, the company said.
For 1997, $450 million has been budgeted for capital spending for all of the company's businesses, it added.
About 70 percent -- or $1.8 billion -- of the five-year budget is targeted for growth projects in the company's core urethanes and performance chemicals businesses, ARCO said.

These projects include expansion of the propylene oxide/styrene monomer and butanediol facilities at Channelview, Texas, and construction of new world scale facilities in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, it said.
The remaining 30 percent of the five-year budget is targeted for environmental, health and safety projects, caretaker and maintenance projects, and administrative programs, the company said.

Chief Executive Alan R. Hirsig observed, "Our new capital spending plan will implement ARCO Chemical Co's long-term strategy of focusing on the core (propylene oxide) businesses, integrating an even greater share of our production into value-added derivatives, and maintaining the company's technological superiority."

The company said it expects to fund its capital spending program through operating cash flows supported by the flexibility it has for either refinancing or additional borrowing. -- New York Newsdesk 212-859-1610
